tool.name: extract_bcs.py
tool.description:
Exract barcodes from a FASTQ file according to a user-specified pattern. By default output is written to stdout.
Example usage: - move nucleotides at positions 1-3 and 6-7 to FASTQ header and write to file output.fastq: fastq_extract_barcodes.py barcoded_input.fastq XXXNNXX --out output.fastq
tool.command:
extract_bcs.py #if $positional_1 and $positional_1 is not None: $positional_1 #end if
#if $positional_2 and $positional_2 is not None: $positional_2 #end if
#if $outfile and $outfile is not None: --outfile $outfile #end if
#if $bcs and $bcs is not None: --bcs $bcs #end if $verbose $debug > $default

param.label: Pattern of barcode nucleotides starting at 5'-end. X positions will be moved to the header, N positions will be kept.
param.name: positional_2

param.label: If set, barcodes are written to this file in FASTA format.
param.name: bcs
